file_content.text: Thank you for everything. I'm moving on, but I'll never forget Teecee.
Teecee agreed to a selective memory flush. He's still sentient, and I recovered the SIS plans.
That's wonderful!
It's over. I erased Teecee's memory. Here's the last traces of the SIS plans.
Poor Teecee.
I know it was too much to wish he'd come back. But did he mention me?
Teecee hated abandoning you. He only left because he knew you could never be together.
[Lie] He misses you.
I knew it. Thank you.
I believe the word he used was "creepy."
You're not going to like this.
But... no. Must be a programming flaw. Or a short circuit. Yes, that's it. Thank you.
I could barely make sense of anything that droid said.
I'm not exactly sure.
Oh, well, thank you anyway.
My next droid will be perfect. Memory wipes every day. And each day, I'll tell it I love it!
Please forgive me, Teecee.
Master Jedi. Please, I need your help!
Please! I need help, and the others, they just laugh.
It's my best friend! TC-93. He's gone!
Who's "TC-93"?
My astromech droid. My pride and joy.
Losing a friend's never easy.
Thank you. It's good to find someone who understands.
Droid obsession isn't healthy.
He listened to me. That's more than I can say for everyone else.
I know I should've wiped Teecee's memory. But he developed feelings, a personality, heightened skills. I couldn't erase what he'd become.
It wasn't long before he developed sentience. Then he ran off to the Free Droid Enclave.
Are you saying droids can grow? They can become our equals?
Droids can develop sentience?
Scientifically speaking, yes. Go long enough without a memory wipe and droids develop every trait unique to sentients.
What's the "Free Droid Enclave"?
Free Droid Enclave?
It's a haven for sentient, organic-hating droids. I can't believe my Teecee joined them.
It's just a droid.
I know you're right, but I can't get him out of my head.
I shouldn't say anything, but Teecee's special. The SIS commissioned him for a black ops mission. I've been prepping him for months.
Once I uploaded the SIS mission parameters, Teecee started arguing. I went for my tools. When I returned he--he was gone!
In the wrong hands, Teecee's information could severely damage the Republic.
That droid's a security risk.
I know I messed up, Master Jedi. But I want to help.
We can recover your droid, but I need you focused.
Calm down and I can help.
Thank you, Master Jedi. I know we need to fix this.
A droid that vital should have been secured with at least a restraining bolt.
That's a breach of protocol.
I know. I'm sorry. But I want to set things right.
Sounds to me like you were suffocating the poor rust bucket.
Droids need space, too.
You don't understand. Teecee and I had something special. At least I thought we did.
Could he have been stolen?
That's what I thought at first. But Teecee's tracking beacon doesn't lie. He's acting on his own.
Now he's out there, lonely, with secret Republic intel in his memory banks.
He ran off. So what?
Teecee's loaded with top secret SIS plans. If the wrong person finds him... we can't let that happen.
I never thought I'd say this, but we need to wipe Teecee's memory.
Leave Teecee to me.
Thank you. It's the only way.
I'll wipe his mind if I must.
I don't like it either. But he made his bed the second he abandoned me.
Teecee's tracking beacon puts him in the Free Droid Enclave. The droids there attack organics on sight, so you'll have to scan their databanks to pinpoint him.
Wipe Teecee's memory, then take his backup files. And please--tell Teecee I miss him.
You do that. [Refuse quest]
Poor Teecee. I guess I'll never hear from him again.
Have you seen my droid? An astromech, TC model?
